content: Government ministry of Singapore The **Ministry of Sustainability and the Environment** (**MSE**; [Malay](/wiki/Malay_language): *Kementerian Kemampanan dan Sekitaran*; [Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language): 永续发展与环境部; [Tamil](/wiki/Tamil_language): நீடித்த நிலைத்தன்மை, சுற்றுப்புற அமைச்சு) is a [ministry](/wiki/Ministry_(government_department)) of the [Government of Singapore](/wiki/Government_of_Singapore) responsible for the formulation and implementation of policies related to the environment, water and food of [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). ## History The Ministry of Sustainability and the Environment (MSE) was established in 1972 as the Ministry of the Environment (ENV). It was later renamed the Ministry of Environment and Water Resources (MEWR) in 2004. On 25 July 2020, the Ministry was renamed to Ministry of Sustainability and the Environment. ## Responsibilities The Ministry is responsible for providing a quality living environment and a high standard of public health, protected against the spread of communicable diseases. It also has to ensure a clean and hygienic living environment, as well as managing the complete [water cycle](/wiki/Water_cycle) – from sourcing, collection, purification, and supply of drinking water; to the treatment of used water and recycling into [NEWater](/wiki/NEWater); desalination; as well as storm water drainage.[*citation needed*] Since 1 April 2019, it also handles food issues through the [Singapore Food Agency](/wiki/Singapore_Food_Agency). ## Organisational structure The Ministry oversees three statutory boards – the [National Environment Agency (NEA)](/wiki/National_Environment_Agency), [Public Utilities Board (PUB)](/wiki/Public_Utilities_Board), and the [Singapore Food Agency (SFA)](/wiki/Singapore_Food_Agency). ### Statutory Boards - [National Environment Agency](/wiki/National_Environment_Agency) - [Public Utilities Board](/wiki/Public_Utilities_Board) - [Singapore Food Agency](/wiki/Singapore_Food_Agency) ## Ministers The Ministry is headed by the **Minister for Sustainability and the Environment**, who is appointed as part of the [Cabinet of Singapore](/wiki/Cabinet_of_Singapore). ### Minister for the Environment (1972–2004) MinisterTook officeLeft officePartyCabinet**[Lim Kim San](/wiki/Lim_Kim_San)** MP for [Cairnhill](/wiki/Cairnhill_Constituency) (1916–2006)16 September 19721 June 1975[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)[Lee K.
